title: Public transport for the Melbourne International Flower and Garden Show: Wednesday 29 March to Sunday 2 April 2023
articleContent:
Public transport for the Melbourne International Flower and Garden Show: Wednesday 29 March to Sunday 2 April 2023

Events > Expos

We're helping green thumbs get to the 2023 Melbourne International Flower and Garden Show!

Public transport is your best way to travel to and from the Royal Exhibition Building and Carlton Gardens. The event runs from Wednesday 29 March to Sunday 2 April 2023 .

Please check the Disruptions page for notification of any service changes that may affect your journey to and from the event.

Plan your journey to and from the Royal Exhibition Building and Carlton Gardens:

More information about services to and from the event is below.

Metropolitan train

Getting to and from Carlton Gardens

No additional trains operate.

Passengers are advised to travel via the City Loop to Parliament Station, located approximately 600 metres from Carlton Gardens.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from Carlton Gardens

Additional trams run from 8:30am to 6pm on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday and 08:30am to 10pm on Friday as Route 30a every 15 minutes between Stop 4 Flinders Street Station, Elizabeth St and Stop 1 Spencer St via Flinders St, Spring St and La Trobe St.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.

Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Carlton Gardens

Passengers can catch the following bus routes close to the Show:

Victoria Street/Victoria Parade

  • Routes 302, 304, 305, 905, 906, 907 and 908
  • Routes 303, 309, 318 and 350 (Weekdays only)

Rathdowne Street

  • Bus routes 250, 251 and 402

Plan your journey using Journey Planner.
articleDescription: Public transport for the Melbourne International Flower and Garden Show: Wednesday 29 March to Sunday 2 April 2023
